channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Barrier fence left and tarmac lumps, 26th February
item.description:
The contractors barrier fence has been left on the pavement since the works were done. Also, there are large lumps of tarmac left in the kerb too.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Leamington Avenue, Sundridge, Greater London

item.description:

item.title: Flytipped mattress, 26th February
item.description:
Flytipped mattress next to the salt grit box outside 185 Leesons Hill. This area is a dumping post for bad actors in the neighbourhood. This has been here for a week. Please can it be removed.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 185, Leesons Hill, St Paul's Cray, Greater London

item.title: Abandoned Vehicle for over 6 months., 26th February
item.description:
There is a car which has been parked in an inconsiderate manner for over 6 months, it does not belong to any of our neighbours and it is preventing other vehicles from parking. We have CCTV showing no one has used the vehicle for many months - approximately 2 weeks ago a gentleman came with a mechanic but the car does not run so has been continuously left here.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bowford Avenue, West Heath, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bins overflowing., 26th February
item.description:
2 full wheelie bins and 7 full sacks. Bins arenâ€™t being g collected for another 6 days. Please enforce the guidelines for this address. This is a consistent problem.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Rushmore Road, Hackney, London

item.title: Root damage to my property, 26th February
item.description:
This birch tree roots are damaging my property. It has damaged my front wall and I am concerned it will eventually damage the foundations to my house. I have spoke to tree surgeons and builders and have confirmed this is root damage, 07711 312196

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Reighton Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Multiple potholes, 26th February
item.description:
Potholes gotten worse last few months. Anyone who hits the potholes with car or buses causes property nearby to shake causing cracks to property.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Yorkland Avenue, Falconwood, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overflowing rubbish bin, 26th February
item.description:
This bin is once again overflowing with rubbish. Litter is now being thrown onto the pavement around the bin, including several dog poo bags. Very unpleasant. This problem is a regular occurrence. Why does not Bromley Council routinely empty the bin? This is our home and it's being made dirty and shabby by poor cleaning schedules.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Blakeney Road, Beckenham, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish littering the grass verge, 26th February
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 17-32, Haseley Close, Forest Hill, Greater London

item.title: Abandoned wheelie bin, 26th February
item.description:
This bin was abandoned on the pavement at Christmas. It's been there since and is being used by passers by as a public bin. Vermin and other pests have been seen around it as a result

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Osterley Road, Hackney, London
